property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={33, 141, 934, 634}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: Set and get example key-value pairs.

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Hokeun Kim

property.name: runCommand
property.value: @node@ ../../../hosts/node/nodeHostInvoke.js utilities/test/auto/@modelName@

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Save and retrieve a value from local storage.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks, based on KeyValueStore by Edward A. Lee and LocalStorage demo by Hokeun Kim.

property.name: baseDirectory (port)
property.value: The directory in which to store the data If there is no value used, then the default value is /tmp/LocalStorage<Random> where <Random> is a random number.

property.name: storeLocation (port)
property.value: The URL of the key-value store service. The storeLocation is converted into a legal filename via substitution

property.name: key (port)
property.value: The key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: remove (port)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: value (port)
property.value: The value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: The trigger input.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: The value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

property.name: debug (port)
property.value: Debug messages.

property.name: list (port)
property.value: If true, then generate a list of all the keys and values on the result.

property.name: notFound (port)
property.value: True if the key was not found.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: script

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: correctValues
property.value: {"apple", "bed", "car", "dog", "eagle", "ace", "car", "dog", "eagle", "ace"}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: description
property.value: Accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.
